pos: nouns which may take the genitive case particle 'no'

lessons.japanese: 君のレインコートがなければ、私はずぶぬれになっていただろう。
lessons.english: If it had not been for your raincoat, I would have been drenched to the skin.

lessons.japanese: 君のレインコートがなかったら私はずぶぬれになっていただろう。
lessons.english: Had it not been for your raincoat, I would have been drenched to the skin.

lessons.japanese: 学校から帰宅途中で、にわか雨にあってずぶぬれになった。
lessons.english: On my way home from school, I was caught in a shower and got wet to the skin.

lessons.japanese: 私はずぶぬれになった。
lessons.english: I got soaked to the skin.

lessons.japanese: にわか雨に降られてずぶぬれになった。
lessons.english: I was utterly soaked by the downpour.

lessons.japanese: 私はにわか雨にあって、ずぶぬれになった。
lessons.english: I was caught in a shower and was drenched to the skin.

lessons.japanese: にわか雨にあい、私はずぶぬれになった。
lessons.english: I was caught in a shower and was drenched to the skin.

lessons.japanese: 彼女は全身ずぶぬれだった。
lessons.english: She was soaked from head to foot.

lessons.japanese: 彼女はずぶぬれになった。
lessons.english: She got wet to the skin.

lessons.japanese: 彼は雨でずぶぬれになった。
lessons.english: He was drenched by the rain.

lessons.japanese: 彼は雨でずぶぬれになった。
lessons.english: He was wet to the skin from the rain.

lessons.japanese: 大雨のために私たちはずぶぬれになった。
lessons.english: Due to the heavy rain we were soaked to the skin.

lessons.japanese: 船上の荷物はずぶぬれになった。
lessons.english: The freight on the ship got soaked.

lessons.japanese: 私は夕立にあって、ずぶぬれになった。
lessons.english: I was caught in a shower and got wet to the skin.
